0090/A0/04/002/004.indicator_name: # of infants aged 0-3 reported as officially abandoned or relinquished during the year
0090/A0/04/002/004.headline: With UNICEF&#39 s facilitation and technical leadership  Albania&#39 s child rights protection machinery was revised in the new Law on Child Rights and Protection  with duty-bearers and right-holders accountabilities clearly defined  professionalization of the Child Protection function resulted in increasing numbers of children supported  national De-Institutionalization Plan for 2017-2019 was developed.

0090/A0/04/002/004.status_value: 106 children per 100 000 child population 0-17 years old

0090/A0/04/002/005.status_value: Early learning and development standards have been endorsed by Minister of Education and Sports
0090/A0/04/002/005.indicator_name: "c2a. Early learning policy and early learning programme including quality early learning curriculum and standards - score (1-4)  see guidance"
0090/A0/04/002/005.headline: In 2016  UNICEF assisted Albania&#39 s Ministry of Education and Sports (MoES) in developing a comprehensive Early Learning and Development policy package  introducing Inclusive Education techniques in classroom management  enrolling Roma children in kindergartens and primary schools  and monitoring and addressing school drop-out.
0090/A0/04/002/005.baseline_value: Pre-University Education Strategy defines actions for early learning
0090/A0/04/002/005.target_value: Endorsement of early learning and development standards

0090/A0/04/002/005.status_value: The National Development and Integration Strategy until 2020 and National Policy Paper for Social Inclusion until 2019 identify concrete objectives and results targets for ECD
0090/A0/04/002/005.indicator_name: political commitment and accountability for developing a comprehensive national approach to ECD is reflected in national strategies and MoES' workplans
0090/A0/04/002/005.headline: In 2016  UNICEF assisted Albania&#39 s Ministry of Education and Sports (MoES) in developing a comprehensive Early Learning and Development policy package  introducing Inclusive Education techniques in classroom management  enrolling Roma children in kindergartens and primary schools  and monitoring and addressing school drop-out.
0090/A0/04/002/005.baseline_value: Pre-University Education Strategy sets a commitment that the pre-primary year will be accessible for all children of 5 years of age (effective by 2018)

0090/A0/04/002/005.status_value: 1) Inclusive Teacher profile and training programmes  2) School based training manual for preventing drop-out  3) Inter-sectorial guidelines to monitoring and integrate out of school children have been endorsed by MoES
0090/A0/04/002/005.indicator_name: Pre-University Education law and respective policies incorporate the principle (and measurable targets) of a child friendly and inclusive school
0090/A0/04/002/005.headline: In 2016  UNICEF assisted Albania&#39 s Ministry of Education and Sports (MoES) in developing a comprehensive Early Learning and Development policy package  introducing Inclusive Education techniques in classroom management  enrolling Roma children in kindergartens and primary schools  and monitoring and addressing school drop-out.
0090/A0/04/002/005.baseline_value: Pre-University Education Law (2012) incorporates these principles in general terms

0090/A0/04/002/005.baseline_value: No coordinated policies and budgets for Early Childhood Development

0090/A0/04/002/005.status_value: a) The positive parenting manual has been used nationally  b) the draft National Action Plan (Agenda) for Children 2016-2020 mainstreams parenting programme among all sectorial components  3) the approved ELDS incorporate components of parents education

0090/A0/04/002/005.baseline_value: --- No national parenting program available in the mother and child health centres and crèches

0090/A0/04/002/005.status_value: 29 percentage points increase in the inclusion of Roma children in pre-school education.

0090/A0/04/002/007.status_value: Revised MCH service standards and protocols endorsed by the MoH  published and being distributed to all MCH centres  cost of services delivered in accordance with these new standards will be measured in 2015
0090/A0/04/002/007.indicator_name: newly upgraded health insurance scheme covers standardised and costed MCH preventive service packages (antenatal care  postnatal care  nutrition  and child growth and development)
0090/A0/04/002/007.baseline_value: No standardization and costing of MCH preventive services  in the context of the on-going health insurance system reform

0090/A0/04/002/001.status_value: MoSWY's decision of June 2014 to start the distribution of "cash assistance" to mothers and link it to children's immunization and school attendance.
0090/A0/04/002/001.indicator_name: ¿Cash assistance¿ entitlement packages and eligibility criteria reformed in accordance with best global practice  to ensure that the needs of children in vulnerable families are met
0090/A0/04/002/001.baseline_value: National ¿cash assistance¿ scheme does not have an impact on health and educational outcomes for children

0090/A0/04/002/001.status_value: Evaluation completed  findings used in the formulation of Albania's Social Inclusion Policy for 2015-2020
0090/A0/04/002/001.indicator_name: National Social Inclusion Strategy (2007-2013) evaluation is completed in time to inform the development of a new social inclusion and protection framework until 2020
0090/A0/04/002/001.baseline_value: Assessment of the national social inclusion efforts effectiveness not available

0090/A0/04/002/008.status_value: Elements of the National Food and Nutrition Plan drafted in 2013 used as inputs for a new national Strategy for Agriculture and Rural Development (2015-2020)drafted
0090/A0/04/002/008.indicator_name: National public health policies updated to explicitly address nutrition issues
0090/A0/04/002/008.baseline_value: Inter-sectoral planning framework to address food and nutrition issues is absent

0090/A0/04/002/008.status_value: No new updates since the completion of the Joint UN Child Nutrition Project and its final evaluation in 2013

0090/A0/04/002/008.baseline_value: Inter-sectoral coordination and planning mechanisms at the local level promoting food security and good nutrition practices are lacking

0090/A0/04/002/008.status_value: Data not collected  since the Joint UN Child Nutrition Project was completed in 2013
0090/A0/04/002/008.indicator_name: In target areas (Kukes  Shkodra  Tirana suburbs)  % of young children (aged 0-23 months) not fed according to minimum acceptable diet

0090/A0/04/002/009.indicator_name: % of adolescents who demonstrate correct knowledge of HIV risks and no misconceptions

0090/A0/04/002/002.status_value: The target of 10 professional social workers for 100 000 population has been established in the recently approved Law on Social Care Services  setting the standard for municipalities to approve/adjust their institutional structures/capacities accordantly.
0090/A0/04/002/002.indicator_name: Political commitment and accountability for social care service reform is reflected in national strategies and MoSWY's workplans
0090/A0/04/002/002.headline: Adoption of Albania&#39 s new Law on Social Care Services was the highlight of 2016. Capacity building programme for newly formed Municipalities has started  to empower local governments to plan  budget and implement social protection policies  in line with the country&#39 s overall decentralization reform and the new Law on Local Self-Government.
0090/A0/04/002/002.baseline_value: No explicit definition and regulations on community-based social care services (non-residential)

0090/A0/04/002/002.status_value: The inclusion of Roma children has been progressively realized using several established sector- and project-based mechanisms at national and local level. The reporting of the indicator in value at this stage is constrained by non-availability of fully compatible data coming from different sources.
0090/A0/04/002/002.indicator_name: in target areas  % of vulnerable children (inclduing Roma) not yet reached by "case managers" from the national social protection services
0090/A0/04/002/002.headline: Adoption of Albania&#39 s new Law on Social Care Services was the highlight of 2016. Capacity building programme for newly formed Municipalities has started  to empower local governments to plan  budget and implement social protection policies  in line with the country&#39 s overall decentralization reform and the new Law on Local Self-Government.
0090/A0/04/002/002.baseline_value: The new Law on Social Worker institutionalises the "case management" as a professional practice

0090/A0/04/002/002.status_value: 100% of the Social Care Services reform pillars (i.e. addressing legislative  institutional  fiscal  capacity and data supply issues) are reflected in the national Social Protection Strategy for 2015-2020.
0090/A0/04/002/002.indicator_name: # of social workers (practicing ¿case management¿) for 100 000 population

0090/A0/04/002/002.status_value: Albania's new Strategy of Social Protection till 2020 approved

Capacity building programme for newly formed Municipalities has started  to empower local governments to plan  budget and implement social protection policies  in line with the country&#39 s overall decentralization reform and the new Law on Local Self-Government.

0090/A0/04/002/014.status_value: At least six mechanisms report and address VAC  i.e.: State Police  CPUs  State Education Inspectorate  MCH care centres  ALO 116 Helpline  ISUGURT online platform (www.isigurt.al).
0090/A0/04/002/014.indicator_name: # and type of national mechanisms collecting evidence and addressing violence against children (child helpline  information gathering by social protection services  anti-VAC programs in schools  etc.)
0090/A0/04/002/014.headline: In 2016  national mechanisms collecting evidence and addressing violence against children continued to expand and strengthen  involving front-line service providers  such as teachers  health care professionals and child protection workers. Violence against and abuse of children in internet received particular attention and response.
0090/A0/04/002/014.baseline_value: no comprehensive national mechanism in place to regularly track the incidence and monitor the response to VAC (remains project-based)

0090/A0/04/002/014.status_value: Reported incidence of violence in teacher-to-student communication and behavior reduced to 40%
0090/A0/04/002/014.indicator_name: % of decrease in the incidence of violence in teacher-to-student communication and behavior in public schools
0090/A0/04/002/014.headline: In 2016  national mechanisms collecting evidence and addressing violence against children continued to expand and strengthen  involving front-line service providers  such as teachers  health care professionals and child protection workers. Violence against and abuse of children in internet received particular attention and response.
0090/A0/04/002/014.baseline_value: More than 60% of schoolchildren report violent treatment by teachers

0090/A0/04/002/010.status_value: Partially included. The national core List and Manual of Health Indicators (adopted in 2016) include child-specific indicators. The List is aligned with the contents of the newly adopted Strategy and Action plan for Reproductive Health 2017-2021  Non-Communicable Diseases National Programme 2016-2020  and the draft national Health Strategy document. Draft Strategy and Action Plan (Agenda) for Children 2016-2020.
0090/A0/04/002/010.indicator_name: equity targets for children are included in the national health strategy
0090/A0/04/002/010.headline: During 2016  UNICEF support to the Ministry of Health focused on the implementation of the new Mother and Child Health (MCH) regulatory framework  by producing a budgetary cost estimation tool  training health care personnel on the MCH standards and data collection  and strengthening legislation on Breast Milk Substitutes (BMS) marketing.

0090/A0/04/002/010.status_value: Key elements of the mechanism (training modules  monitoring instruments  costing estimate tool) are developed and tested in the target region of Durres.
0090/A0/04/002/010.indicator_name: enforcement mechanisms are in place to support scaling up of system changes in MCH preventive services based on recently approved MCH regulatory framework
0090/A0/04/002/010.headline: During 2016  UNICEF support to the Ministry of Health focused on the implementation of the new Mother and Child Health (MCH) regulatory framework  by producing a budgetary cost estimation tool  training health care personnel on the MCH standards and data collection  and strengthening legislation on Breast Milk Substitutes (BMS) marketing.
0090/A0/04/002/010.baseline_value: enforcement and accountability/performance monitoring mechanism not in place

0090/A0/04/002/010.status_value: Indicator not relevant beyond the MDG-F project completed in 2014

0090/A0/04/002/010.baseline_value: Child growth is not monitored systematically

0090/A0/04/002/015.indicator_name: formal certification of environmental education curricula modules for primary school (Grades 1-5)
0090/A0/04/002/015.baseline_value: Modules tested in about 15% of Albanian schools

0090/A0/04/002/013.status_value: Law adopted in 2012 with Child Friendly School (CFS) principles reflected  CFS framework and assessment tool developed but not mandatory for schools
0090/A0/04/002/013.indicator_name: Pre-University Education law and respective policies incorporate the principle (and measurable targets) of a child friendly and inclusive school

0090/A0/04/002/013.status_value: Latest available measurements (2012-2013 academic year vs. 2011-2012)  At regional level ¿ Berat: school dropout decreased from 0.7 per cent to 0.55 per cent  Durres: decreased from 0.79 per cent to 0.08 per cent  Korça: increased slightly from 0.9 to 1.2 per cent  In 10 most problematic schools in target areas ¿ Berat: school dropout decreased from 2.5 per cent to 1.46 per cent  Durres: decreased from 0.44 per cent to 0 per cent  Korça: decreased from 1.8 per cent to 1.35 per cent
0090/A0/04/002/013.indicator_name: % of drop-outs (boys and girls) in target areas that are considered to be especially affected
0090/A0/04/002/013.baseline_value: No data in the absence of denominator figures (disaggregated 2011 Population Census info released in May 2013)

0090/A0/04/001/003.indicator_name: Business associations publish corporate social responsibility standards that include attention to children
0090/A0/04/001/003.headline: The highlights of the year 2016 included the &#39 #I PROTECT CHILDREN&#39  and &#39 OPEN YOUR EYES&#39  communication campaigns addressing violence against children  with the celebration of UNICEF&#39 s 70th anniversary in December becoming a symbolic moment of recognition of Albania&#39 s achievements and challenges in upholding and protecting children&#39 s rights.
0090/A0/04/001/003.baseline_value: Baseline status to be determined (social responsibility provisions are increasingly applied by industries but the picture is fragmented)

0090/A0/04/001/003.status_value: Monitoring of child ethical violations in the media is taking place  10 such cases have been managed by the Albanian Media Authority in 2016.
0090/A0/04/001/003.indicator_name: Standards on socially responsible reporting in the media respecting children
0090/A0/04/001/003.headline: The highlights of the year 2016 included the &#39 #I PROTECT CHILDREN&#39  and &#39 OPEN YOUR EYES&#39  communication campaigns addressing violence against children  with the celebration of UNICEF&#39 s 70th anniversary in December becoming a symbolic moment of recognition of Albania&#39 s achievements and challenges in upholding and protecting children&#39 s rights.

0090/A0/04/001/001.headline: UNICEF assisted Albania&#39 s Parliament and national human rights institutions to strengthen their oversight of duty-bearers&#39  accountability for child rights upholding (with focus  in 2016  on the situation of children in detention  in residential care and on the move)  civil society partners were supported in strategic litigation cases for child rights.
0090/A0/04/001/001.baseline_value: No institutional system for child rights monitoring prior to the adoption of the Law #10347 ¿On the Protection of the Rights of the Child¿ (came into force in June 2011)

0090/A0/04/001/001.status_value: At least 7 discussions on issues related to children: 1.	Plenary session reviews of the Annual Report of the People's Advocate and of the Commissioner for Protection from Discrimination  including for child rights cases. 2.	One public hearing session of the Parliamentary Sub-commission on Children  Gender Equality and Domestic Violence (24.05.2016) with regard to the situation of child abuse in residential care facilities.  3.	One hearing session of the Parliamentary Commission on Education and
0090/A0/04/001/001.indicator_name: # of parliamentary hearings /standing committee discussions annually on child-related issues

0090/A0/04/001/001.status_value: For 2015: Of 136 cases of child-related concerns reviewed by the People's Advocate 56 (43%) were either resolved positively to the benefit of the children concerned  or followed up with recommendations by the People's Advocate  in favour of the child.
0090/A0/04/001/001.indicator_name: % of major child-related complaints effectively addressed by the Ombudsman Office (of the total number submitted to Ombudsman) annually

0090/A0/04/001/007.status_value: Analysis completed  final report prepared and shared with stakeholders

0090/A0/04/001/007.baseline_value: No evidence of correlation between ECD services and women's empowerment

0090/A0/04/001/005.status_value: Draft Criminal Justice for Children Code currently under parliamentary review
0090/A0/04/001/005.indicator_name: system in place to monitor that children in contact with the law (whether civil  administrative or criminal) are treated according to standards
0090/A0/04/001/005.headline: UNICEF's advocacy  technical and financial assistance were essential for the development of Albania's draft Criminal Justice for Children Code  as well as for the expansion of measures alternative to detention of children and young people in conflict with the law ¿ now applied in the majority of juvenile offence cases.

0090/A0/04/001/005.status_value: Draft Criminal Justice for Children Code and draft Law on Child Rights and Protection (both under parliamentary review) improve children's position as rights holders in relation to administrative and judicial processes. A draft Legal Aid Law  is also under parliamentary review.
0090/A0/04/001/005.indicator_name: clearly defined channels in place in public administration for lodging complaints related to children

0090/A0/04/001/005.status_value: 100% of detention sites have arrangements for primary education of juveniles  However  a recent People's Advocate Report indicated that in Lezha detention facility  classrooms looked like they were not used for a long time and that juveniles were not in the classrooms at a time of the day where they should have been. -100% of detention sites have arrangements for vocational training (on a limited range of professions)  -0% - have arrangements for secondary education programs
0090/A0/04/001/005.indicator_name: % of detention sites for juveniles ensuring adequate education opportunities
0090/A0/04/001/005.headline: UNICEF's advocacy  technical and financial assistance were essential for the development of Albania's draft Criminal Justice for Children Code  as well as for the expansion of measures alternative to detention of children and young people in conflict with the law ¿ now applied in the majority of juvenile offence cases.
0090/A0/04/001/005.baseline_value: Very limited education opportunities for juveniles in detention
